definition: blueprint/source material on which later works (books, movies etc) are based
root/stem/origin/source/this/the current/original/inherent/originally/classifier for books, periodicals, files etc

sentences.english: According to Xie Wanglin's best-selling novel, based on the reality.
sentences.chinese: 根据谢旺霖同名畅销小说改编，真人真事为蓝本。

sentences.english: Izurieta based much of his tactical thinking on Sun Tzu’s “Art of War.”
sentences.chinese: 伊苏列塔的战术思维主要以《孙子兵法》为蓝本。

sentences.english: But the law system in the Tang Dynasty was so perfected that successive dynasties regarded it as their original erasing.
sentences.chinese: 但是唐律体制完备，是后代封建王朝的法律蓝本。

sentences.english: The film ___a novel by Lu Xun.
sentences.chinese: 这部电影以鲁迅的小说为蓝本。

sentences.english: This episode marks the first episode where a new introductory credits style is used.
sentences.chinese: 这一季以第一季为蓝本，使用了新的入场信用模式。

sentences.english: It is the blueprint of the teaching of vocal music in China.
sentences.chinese: 美声唱法成了中国声乐教学的蓝本。

sentences.english: Its obsessive clarity turns out to be theperfect basis for digital information.
sentences.chinese: 它那令人着迷的清晰被证明是数字化信息的最佳蓝本。

sentences.english: Zheng Zhen always writing to Du Fu as a model was not accidental.
sentences.chinese: 郑珍在创作上始终以杜诗为蓝本绝非偶然。

sentences.english: Blithedale is modeled on the transcendentalist community at brook farm.
sentences.chinese: 福谷是以“小溪农场”的超验主义者公社为蓝本的。

sentences.english: Several of Hoffmann's stories provided the basis for operas and ballets.
sentences.chinese: 霍夫曼的几部小说都被用作了歌剧和芭蕾舞剧的蓝本。

definition: to draw on (others' experience)/to learn from (how others do things)/lesson to be learned (by observing others)
to consult a reference/to refer to (another document)
to create/to build/to develop/to forge (of metal)
to design/to plot/to plan out/to compose/to draw a mental sketch/conception/plan/idea/composition
to give a name to/to dub/to christen/to designate/named after/naming
to be born/(fig.) to develop out of sth else (of ideas, stories, political systems etc)/(fig.) to shed one's body (to be reborn)/bodiless (e.g. lacquerware)
